title: CI Boost: Arm64 Runners Go Green!

topics.title: User Interface Improvements
topics.summary: Multiple pull requests have focused on fixing UI issues, including style adjustments for media elements, tooltips, and padding. These enhancements aim to improve the overall user experience and ensure consistency across the platform.

topics.title: Testing Enhancements
topics.summary: Recent merged pull requests focus on adding various tests for utilities and components, including binary detection, file icons, and color utilities. These improvements aim to enhance the reliability and functionality of the codebase, ensuring better performance and user experience.

topics.title: Internationalization and Accessibility
topics.summary: Recent updates include improvements to internationalization with new translations and fixes for accessibility issues. These changes ensure that the platform is more inclusive and usable for a diverse audience, enhancing the overall user experience.

topics.title: Documentation and Community Updates
topics.summary: Several pull requests have been merged to enhance documentation, including updates to the Contributor Covenant and the addition of community projects to the README. These changes aim to foster a more inclusive and informative environment for contributors and users.

topics.title: Performance and CI Enhancements
topics.summary: A recent pull request has transitioned the CI to use arm64 runners, resulting in significant performance improvements and reduced carbon footprint. This change reflects a commitment to sustainability while enhancing the efficiency of the development process.

topics.title: Community Engagement and Feedback
topics.summary: Bluesky posts highlight community engagement with npmx, showcasing user feedback and interactions. These discussions reflect the vibrant community surrounding the project and emphasize the importance of collaboration and support among users and contributors.
